description.plain: Cash Cash is an American electronic dance music group from Roseland, New Jersey. The group consists of the brothers Jean Paul Makhlouf and Alex Makhlouf, along with Samuel Frisch. They are currently signed to Big Beat/Atlantic Records and their highest charting song to date is “Take Me Home”, which features vocals by American singer-songwriter Bebe Rexha. As of 2017, the group has released four full-length albums, an array of EPs, singles, and provided official remixes for acts such as Krewella, Capital Cities, Kelly Clarkson, Katy Perry, Bruno Mars, and Icona Pop, along with producing and co-writing Krewella’s single “Live for the Night”.

songs.full_title: How to Love by Cash Cash (Ft. Sofía Reyes)
songs.title: How to Love

description.plain:
“How to Love” is a song by  American electronic dance music group Cash Cash featuring Mexican pop singer Sofia Reyes.

“This one was a cool one because we all felt a connection to the lyrics,” Cash Cash group member Jean Paul Makhlouf told Genius on June 27, 2016. “Being on tour all the time sometimes it’s tough to maintain normal relationships, even just like friendships, not even on a romantic level. The song is more on the love level. It’s cool because the song stirs up a different emotion in anybody. For me, it’s when you’re on the road and barely have five minutes to talk to someone or when you’re in different timezones it gets so frustrating. We’re still learning how to grow as people and learning how to love in a way that is feasible for two people being in a situation that touring musicians are in.”

“Romantically, we all have been in and out of relationships in the whole process. You learn a little bit from each one on what you did wrong and how you can improve the relationship being on tour. It’s one of those things constantly evolving,” Makhlouf added.

Cash Cash wrote the song before adding Reyes on vocals. “When she heard the song she was very much into the vibe and found it relatable. You can feel that in her vocal performance. She was very connected to the lyrics,” Makhlouf said.

The video for “How to Love” was shot in L.A. in a location similar to a green house and it helped achieve the exact look that the group wanted.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=peByeoQhjMM

The actual creation of the track was effortless and done in one day.

“I flew to record the song and it was done in hours,” said Reyes. “I got to know them and they’re so great.”

Both the group and Reyes felt that this collaboration was seamless and will most likely not be the last of its kind.

“It would be great to have them on my album and work together again,” said the Latina singer. “That would be amazing.”

The group, which consist of brothers Jean Paul Makhlouf and Alex Makhlouf along with friend Frisch, definitely knew how to pin-point talent like Sofia.

The 20-year-old singer just became the first solo lead female act to hit No. 1 on the Latin Pop Songs chart in five years, with her latest single “Solo Yo” and its english version “Nobody But Me” featuring Prince Royce.

songs.embed_content: Read “How to Love” by Cash Cash on Genius

album.name: Blood, Sweat & 3 Years

songs.lyrics:
23 ContributorsHow to Love Lyrics[Intro]
One two three

[Verse 1]
I've been running from the pain
Trying not to feel the same
But it's a shame that we're sinking
See, my confidence is shaking
And my heart is feeling vacant
So you try to fill it in

[Pre-Chorus]
You say "I could fix the broken in your heart
You're worth saving, darling"
But I don't know why you're shooting in the dark
I got faith in nothing

[Chorus]
But love, pray for me
I never had somebody
So I don't know how to love
Pray for me
I know I need somebody
So I can learn how to love

[Verse 2]
I know it's been a while
Cause my memory's on trial
For the way I used to be
My head is running miles
Round in circles and I try
To find the little light in me
You might also like[Pre-Chorus]
You say "I could fix the broken in your heart
You're worth saving, darling"
But I don't know why you're shooting in the dark
I got faith in nothing

[Chorus]
But love, pray for me
I never had somebody
So I don't know how to love
Pray for me
I know I need somebody
So I can learn how to love

[Outro]
I know I need somebody
I know I need somebody
I know I need somebody
So I can learn how to love
How to love
How to love
So I can learn how to love
How to love
How to love
How to love
Love, love, love, love, love, love, oh
I know I need somebody
I know I need somebody
I know I need somebody
So I can learn how to love
(Need somebody now
How to love, love
How to love, love)12Embed

songs.full_title: Take Me Home by Cash Cash (Ft. Bebe Rexha)
songs.title: Take Me Home

description.plain:
“Take Me Home” is a song by American DJ trio Cash Cash and American singer Bebe Rexha, from the former’s third EP, Blood, Sweat & 3 Years.

The song propelled Bebe Rexha to newfound international fame. “Take Me Home” remains one of Cash Cash’s most famous songs.

“Take Me Home” is about the longing for a feeling of comfort in a relationship.  The singer describes her dysfunctional relationship and how she wants to take it to the next level by having her significant other “take [her] home”.  The meaning behind the “take me home” line is two-fold; the singer both literally wants her partner to take her home and introduce her to her partner’s parents to move their relationship forward and metaphorical in the sense that she wants their relationship to be less chaotic.
